alerts.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Watch issued June 3 at 2:17PM CDT until June 3 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
alerts.description:
THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH
360 IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING AREAS

IN OKLAHOMA THIS WATCH INCLUDES 38 COUNTIES

IN CENTRAL OKLAHOMA

CANADIAN              CLEVELAND             GRADY
KINGFISHER            LINCOLN               LOGAN
MCCLAIN               OKLAHOMA              PAYNE
POTTAWATOMIE

IN EAST CENTRAL OKLAHOMA

PONTOTOC              SEMINOLE

IN NORTHERN OKLAHOMA

GARFIELD              GRANT                 KAY
NOBLE

IN NORTHWEST OKLAHOMA

ALFALFA               BLAINE                DEWEY
MAJOR                 WOODS

IN SOUTHEAST OKLAHOMA

HUGHES

IN SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA

CARTER                GARVIN                JEFFERSON
MURRAY                STEPHENS

IN SOUTHWEST OKLAHOMA

CADDO                 COMANCHE              COTTON
GREER                 HARMON                JACKSON
KIOWA                 TILLMAN

IN WESTERN OKLAHOMA

BECKHAM               CUSTER                WASHITA

IN TEXAS THIS WATCH INCLUDES 8 COUNTIES

IN NORTHERN TEXAS

ARCHER                BAYLOR                CLAY
FOARD                 HARDEMAN              KNOX
WICHITA               WILBARGER

THIS INCLUDES THE CITIES OF ADA, ALTUS, ALVA, ANADARKO,
ARCHER CITY, ARDMORE, BLACKWELL, BLANCHARD, BURNS FLAT, CARMEN,
CHANDLER, CHEROKEE, CHICKASHA, CLINTON, CONCHO, CORDELL, CROWELL,
DAVENPORT, DAVIS, DUNCAN, EL RENO, ELK CITY, ENID, FAIRVIEW,
FREDERICK, GEARY, GRANITE, GUTHRIE, HELENA, HENNESSEY, HENRIETTA,
HINTON, HOBART, HOLDENVILLE, HOLLIDAY, HOLLIS, KINGFISHER,
KNOX CITY, LAKESIDE CITY, LAMONT, LAWTON, LEEDEY, LINDSAY,
MANGUM, MEDFORD, MEEKER, MOORE, MUNDAY, MUSTANG, NEWCASTLE,
NORMAN, OKARCHE, OKEENE, OKLAHOMA CITY, PAULS VALLEY, PERRY,
PONCA CITY, POND CREEK, PRAGUE, PURCELL, QUANAH, RINGLING, RYAN,
SAYRE, SCOTLAND, SEILING, SEMINOLE, SENTINEL, SEYMOUR, SHAWNEE,
SHEPPARD AFB, SNYDER, STILLWATER, STROUD, SULPHUR, TALOGA,
TEMPLE, TUTTLE, VERNON, VICI, WAKITA, WALTERS, WATONGA, WAURIKA,
WEATHERFORD, WELLSTON, WETUMKA, WEWOKA, WICHITA FALLS, WYNNEWOOD,
AND YUKON.

alerts.headline: Flood Watch issued June 3 at 1:41AM CDT until June 4 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
alerts.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be
possible.

* WHERE...Portions of Oklahoma, including the following counties,
Atoka, Blaine, Bryan, Caddo, Canadian, Carter, Cleveland, Coal,
Comanche, Cotton, Garfield, Garvin, Grady, Grant, Hughes,
Jefferson, Johnston, Kay, Kingfisher, Kiowa, Lincoln, Logan, Love,
Marshall, McClain, Murray, Noble, Oklahoma, Payne, Pontotoc,
Pottawatomie, Seminole, Stephens, Tillman and Washita and northern
Texas, including the following counties, Archer, Clay and Wichita.

* WHEN...Through 7 am Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,
creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- Widespread 1 to 2 inches of rainfall with locally 3 to 4
inches possible.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 2 at 7:46PM CDT until June 3 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Walker, Polk, San Jacinto
and Trinity Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River near Normangee affecting Grimes, Madison and
Brazos Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Riverside...Minor flooding is
forecast.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Navasota River near Normangee.

* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.

* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water
escapes the main channel and inundates the floodplain.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 15.2 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 7:00 PM CDT Monday was 15.8 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
tomorrow morning and continue falling to 13.7 feet Saturday
evening.
- Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
15.2 feet on 03/31/2007.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Brazos, TX; Grimes, TX; Madison, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 10:29AM CDT until June 7 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Alto affecting Angelina, Houston, Anderson and
Cherokee Counties.

For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto,
Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Alto.

* WHEN...Until Saturday evening.

* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river
will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment
near the river to higher ground.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 9:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.7 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 9:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 16.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
Friday morning and continue falling to 15.3 feet Sunday
morning.
- Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Anderson, TX; Angelina, TX; Cherokee, TX; Houston, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 10:33AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Diboll affecting Angelina, Trinity and Polk
Counties.

For the Neches River...including Diboll...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Diboll.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs.  Expect
flooded boat ramps and trails.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 10:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.2 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 10:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 12.2 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.3
feet tomorrow morning.
- Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Angelina, TX; Polk, TX; Trinity, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 2 at 7:46PM CDT until June 7 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Walker, Polk, San Jacinto
and Trinity Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River near Normangee affecting Grimes, Madison and
Brazos Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Riverside...Minor flooding is
forecast.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.

* WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...At 134.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with the
boat ramp in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision in Walker
County inundated. Backwater flooding up Thomas Lake in Walker
County floods the boat ramp in the Green Rich Shores Subdivision
in Walker County.
At 135.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues as significant
backwater up Thomas Lake floods the lowest areas in the Green Rich
Shore Subdivision in Walker County with the boat ramp completely
inundated. The lowest lying areas in the Deep River Plantation
Subdivision and FM 980 northwest of Riverside are threatened.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 134.7 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 133.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 7:30 PM CDT Monday was 134.8 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
early Saturday morning and continue falling to 133.2 feet
Saturday evening.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
134.7 feet on 05/14/1958.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Polk, TX; San Jacinto, TX; Trinity, TX; Walker, TX

alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Angelina River Near Lufkin affecting Angelina and Nacogdoches
Counties.

For the Angelina River...including Alto, NACOGDOCHES, Lufkin...Minor
flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Angelina River near Lufkin.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 162.0 feet, Minor lowland to diminish and end on the
lower Angelina River.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 10:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 163.0 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 158.5 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 10:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 163.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 163.3
feet early Thursday afternoon.
- Flood stage is 161.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto,
Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Neches.

* WHEN...Until late Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding.  Move livestock
and equipment to higher ground away from the river.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 9:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.9 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 9:30 AM CDT Tuesday was 14.1 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.9
feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage
Saturday afternoon.
- Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

evening.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 2 at 7:46PM CDT until June 7 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Walker, Polk, San Jacinto
and Trinity Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River near Normangee affecting Grimes, Madison and
Brazos Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Riverside...Minor flooding is
forecast.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.

* WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...At 134.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with the
boat ramp in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision in Walker
County inundated. Backwater flooding up Thomas Lake in Walker
County floods the boat ramp in the Green Rich Shores Subdivision
in Walker County.
At 135.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues as significant
backwater up Thomas Lake floods the lowest areas in the Green Rich
Shore Subdivision in Walker County with the boat ramp completely
inundated. The lowest lying areas in the Deep River Plantation
Subdivision and FM 980 northwest of Riverside are threatened.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 134.7 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 133.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 7:30 PM CDT Monday was 134.8 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
early Saturday morning and continue falling to 133.2 feet
Saturday evening.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
134.7 feet on 05/14/1958.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Polk, TX; San Jacinto, TX; Trinity, TX; Walker, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 2:00PM CDT until June 6 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River Near Easterly affecting Leon and Robertson
Counties.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Navasota River near Easterly.

* WHEN...From this evening to early Friday morning.

* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur from
below Easterly to below Highway 21. Cattle in the flood plain
could be affected.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 1:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 18.6 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet.
- Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage
this evening to a crest of 19.8 feet late tomorrow evening.
It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon.
alerts.areaDesc: Leon, TX; Robertson, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Watch issued June 3 at 1:41AM CDT until June 4 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
alerts.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be
possible.

* WHERE...Portions of Oklahoma, including the following counties,
Atoka, Blaine, Bryan, Caddo, Canadian, Carter, Cleveland, Coal,
Comanche, Cotton, Garfield, Garvin, Grady, Grant, Hughes,
Jefferson, Johnston, Kay, Kingfisher, Kiowa, Lincoln, Logan, Love,
Marshall, McClain, Murray, Noble, Oklahoma, Payne, Pontotoc,
Pottawatomie, Seminole, Stephens, Tillman and Washita and northern
Texas, including the following counties, Archer, Clay and Wichita.

* WHEN...Through 7 am Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,
creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- Widespread 1 to 2 inches of rainfall with locally 3 to 4
inches possible.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

- Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage
this evening to a crest of 19.8 feet late tomorrow evening.
It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon.
alerts.areaDesc: Leon, TX; Robertson, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 10:29AM CDT until June 7 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Alto affecting Angelina, Houston, Anderson and
Cherokee Counties.

For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto,
Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Alto.

* WHEN...Until Saturday evening.

* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river
will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment
near the river to higher ground.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 9:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.7 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 9:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 16.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
Friday morning and continue falling to 15.3 feet Sunday
morning.
- Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Neches affecting Anderson and Cherokee Counties.

For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto,
Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Neches.

* WHEN...Until late Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding.  Move livestock
and equipment to higher ground away from the river.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...

- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 9:30 AM CDT Tuesday was 14.1 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.9
feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage
Saturday afternoon.
- Flood stage is 12.0 feet.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 2 at 7:46PM CDT until June 3 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Walker, Polk, San Jacinto
and Trinity Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River near Normangee affecting Grimes, Madison and
Brazos Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Riverside...Minor flooding is
forecast.
For the Navasota River...including Normangee...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Navasota River near Normangee.

* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.

* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water
escapes the main channel and inundates the floodplain.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 15.2 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 7:00 PM CDT Monday was 15.8 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
tomorrow morning and continue falling to 13.7 feet Saturday
evening.
- Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
15.2 feet on 03/31/2007.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
